item.title: ABB India Q3 FY26: Margin Compression Shadows Strong Revenue Growth
item.description: ABB India Ltd., the country's largest heavy electrical equipment manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹124,701 crores, delivered a mixed performance in Q3 FY26 (Oct-Dec'25), as robust revenue growth failed to translate into proportionate bottom-line expansion. The company reported consolidated net profit of ₹432.85 crores for the quarter, representing a modest sequential increase of 5.82% from Q2 FY26's ₹409.04 crores, but marking a year-on-year decline of 1.73% from Q3 FY25's ₹528.41 crores. The stock reacted negatively to the results, declining 2.82% to close at ₹5,715.65 on February 19, 2026. Time: Feb 19 2026 10:30 PM IST

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 4,084 companies reporting results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings outcomes has inched up to 46.0%, sectoral and market-capitalisation distinctions highlight a complex landscape for investors navigating growth and value opportunities. Time: Feb 19 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Are Impex Ferro Tech Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Impex Ferro Tech Ltd's latest results are concerning, with net sales of ₹0.00 crore for three consecutive quarters and a net loss of ₹1.81 crores, indicating severe operational and financial challenges without a clear path to recovery. The company's high debt-to-equity ratio and negative book value further reflect investor pessimism about its future. Time: Feb 19 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Are Sparc Electrex Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Sparc Electrex Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are poor, showing a net loss of ₹0.97 crores and a 93.94% decline in revenues, indicating severe operational challenges and a need for strategic reassessment. The company's financial metrics reflect significant inefficiencies and ongoing cash burn, raising concerns about its viability. Time: Feb 19 2026 07:11 PM IST

item.title: Eureka Forbes Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Eureka Forbes Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock’s long-term strength amid underwhelming market performance. Time: Feb 19 2026 06:00 PM IST
